item.title: Spring Boot: Use Thymeleaf without MVC
item.description: Recently I was working on refactoring a purchase automation system that collects order data from various data sources, performs some pipeline computation and generates a human-readable daily report to our purchase specialists. The previous code generates an XLSX file where heterogeneous information is mixed into a single sheet ponderously and presented as rows whose non-empty columns differ. It’s hard to read, and the code is hard to maintain. Regular order statistics and various warnings are collected during the computation.
